chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why they are important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Like this video and keep your energy high.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: The thing is that your website should run on all devices in iPad, iPhone, Android, Surface Pro 4.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Because we have to give a good experience to all users through our website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: In this video, we will also learn that there is a hidden tool in Chrome called Lighthouse.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And how you can use it to enhance your website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So write in the comment section below, Sigma Batch OP.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Let's go to the computer screen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Let's roll the intro.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So guys, I have come to my computer screen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And now I will make a new folder whose name is Video 6.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Video 6.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And here in Video 6, I will open VS Code as always.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And the thing I am going to tell you today is very important from the aspect of SEO.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: First of all, I want to tell you what is SEO?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: If you see any website, it has SEO in it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Let's take the example of Amazon.in.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: I opened Amazon.in.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So Amazon.in wants this website to be loaded as soon as possible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So that their products can come in search.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Google is a search engine.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Google's responsibility is to show the best pages to the users.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So Google wants to show only those pages that are fast.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: They present the information very well.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And along with that, there are some things in them that the user has a good experience.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: For example, let's say there are two pages.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: One page has told about dog food.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: The other page has also told exactly the same thing about dog food.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: But the page 2 of these two is loaded very fast.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: It loads well.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So Google will give it more preference.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Along with that, there are core web vitals.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Which Google considers to rank two pages.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: First of all, it is content.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Content is the most important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: What do you have on one page?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: If your content is good, then maybe your website can rank without core web vitals.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: But if you are competing with a page that has presented almost similar quality content.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Then your core web vitals will be seen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And if your core web vitals are good, then you will be given preference.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So the first thing that comes in the core web vitals is your CLS.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: You see this video here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Which I have run from web.dev website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: You will see that someone comes to your website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And he is trying to cancel the order here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And by mistake, the time he canceled, this thing above became visible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And he shifted the layout.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And the order is complete.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: But the user wanted the order to be incomplete.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: He wanted to click on no.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: In this case, the user experience is very bad.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And as you saw in this video, it should not be like this.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: That's why our CLS should be as low as possible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Now what is the definition of CLS?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Cumulative layout shift means.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: How much is shifting while the page is loading.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Assume that you have loaded the page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And first of all, you get to see this.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: It was above first.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And after that, when this keyterm part was loaded.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So everything shifted down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: The layout should not shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: If you put width and height in images.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Then the layout will not shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And LCP stands for Largest Contextual Paint.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: This means that if the user is viewing a page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Then the biggest element on it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: For example, the biggest part in this is this image.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: How long is it loading?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Means the whole page will be loaded.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: But the biggest looking element.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Which is the most important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: How long is it loading?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: According to web.dev and Google.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: A good LCP score should be 2.5 seconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Means the biggest element should be loaded in 2.5 seconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: After this comes the third metric which is FID.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Which stands for First Input Delay.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: First Input Delay means that.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: If any user has clicked on any input element.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Like on a button or any type of input on a page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So how long does that input process?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: For example, if you click on a button.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So how long does that button click browser process?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And according to Google and web.dev.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Your input should start processing in less than 100 milliseconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So these were the three core web vitals.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Which are very important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: For your information.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: These core web vitals are updated.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: But these three are very important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And you should know.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Now I will show you.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: What is a lighthouse report?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And why do they generate?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And how will these three core web vitals get their value from there?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So I will tell you here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: If you will inspect by right clicking.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And you might have it on the right side.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So you can click here and bring it down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: By clicking here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: If you want you can bring it here again.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And by clicking here you can bring it down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: I prefer it down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Because I am used to seeing it down from the starting.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Now you can see the option of lighthouse here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Lighthouse basically generates a report for you.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And tells you what can be improved in your HTML page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: For example, if I want to see here on mobile.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: How mobile users are seeing my website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So I will click on mobile.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Or I will click on desktop.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: I will close this tab.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: I will click on mobile.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And I will click on analyze page load here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So this will generate a report for me.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Lighthouse.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: You can see here that a report has been generated.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: In this performance, accessibility, best practices, SE and PWA.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Now you can see here that some things are shown in red.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: That is, the scope of improvement is in the page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Now you can see here that it is telling you to size your images properly.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Your website can be loaded 2.7 seconds fast.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So all these suggestions are given to you.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: By lighthouse.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And if you incorporate these suggestions.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Then your website will be loaded very well.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And will give a good experience to the user.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Now you can see here that image elements do not have explicit width and height.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So you should give width and height.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So you should use the width and height attribute of the image.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Which we read in the last video.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: You should use it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So that your browser has space.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: When we set width and height in HTML.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Then there is space in the browser.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Otherwise, if we do not set height and width.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Then what will happen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Our browser will not know how much space to reserve.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And as long as CSS will load.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: The whole page will shift from bottom to top.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So we don't want our page to shift during loading time.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: If our page starts shifting.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So if we are going to click here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Then we can click here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Suppose an image was going to come here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: I am going to click here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And as soon as I clicked.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: This image was loaded.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And all this content shifted down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And instead of clicking here by mistake.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: I will click on the image.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: This is called cumulative layout shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So this kind of shift is not preferred at all.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Google does not prefer at all.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And this should be minimum.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: You can see that the space is very less.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Cumulative layout shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So we have to keep the cumulative layout shift minimum.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So that our user can get a very good experience.

text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why they are important. Like this video and keep your energy high. The thing is that your website should run on all devices in iPad, iPhone, Android, Surface Pro 4. Because we have to give a good experience to all users through our website. In this video, we will also learn that there is a hidden tool in Chrome called Lighthouse. And how you can use it to enhance your website. So write in the comment section below, Sigma Batch OP. Let's go to the computer screen. Let's roll the intro. So guys, I have come to my computer screen. And now I will make a new folder whose name is Video 6. Video 6. And here in Video 6, I will open VS Code as always. And the thing I am going to tell you today is very important from the aspect of SEO. First of all, I want to tell you what is SEO? SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. If you see any website, it has SEO in it. Let's take the example of Amazon.in. I opened Amazon.in. So Amazon.in wants this website to be loaded as soon as possible. So that their products can come in search. Google is a search engine. Google's responsibility is to show the best pages to the users. So Google wants to show only those pages that are fast. They present the information very well. And along with that, there are some things in them that the user has a good experience. For example, let's say there are two pages. One page has told about dog food. The other page has also told exactly the same thing about dog food. But the page 2 of these two is loaded very fast. It loads well. So Google will give it more preference. Along with that, there are core web vitals. Which Google considers to rank two pages. First of all, it is content. Content is the most important. What do you have on one page? If your content is good, then maybe your website can rank without core web vitals. But if you are competing with a page that has presented almost similar quality content. Then your core web vitals will be seen. And if your core web vitals are good, then you will be given preference. So the first thing that comes in the core web vitals is your CLS. You see this video here. Which I have run from web.dev website. You will see that someone comes to your website. And he is trying to cancel the order here. And by mistake, the time he canceled, this thing above became visible. And he shifted the layout. And the order is complete. But the user wanted the order to be incomplete. He wanted to click on no. In this case, the user experience is very bad. And as you saw in this video, it should not be like this. That's why our CLS should be as low as possible. Now what is the definition of CLS? Cumulative layout shift means. How much is shifting while the page is loading. Assume that you have loaded the page. And first of all, you get to see this. It was above first. And after that, when this keyterm part was loaded. So everything shifted down. The layout should not shift. If you put width and height in images. Then the layout will not shift. The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP. And LCP stands for Largest Contextual Paint. This means that if the user is viewing a page. Then the biggest element on it. For example, the biggest part in this is this image. How long is it loading? Means the whole page will be loaded. But the biggest looking element. Which is the most important. How long is it loading? According to web.dev and Google. A good LCP score should be 2.5 seconds. Means the biggest element should be loaded in 2.5 seconds. After this comes the third metric which is FID. Which stands for First Input Delay. First Input Delay means that. If any user has clicked on any input element. Like on a button or any type of input on a page. So how long does that input process? For example, if you click on a button. So how long does that button click browser process? And according to Google and web.dev. Your input should start processing in less than 100 milliseconds. So these were the three core web vitals. Which are very important. For your information. These core web vitals are updated. But these three are very important. And you should know. Now I will show you. What is a lighthouse report? And why do they generate? And how will these three core web vitals get their value from there? So I will tell you here. If you will inspect by right clicking. And you might have it on the right side. So you can click here and bring it down. By clicking here. If you want you can bring it here again. And by clicking here you can bring it down. I prefer it down. Because I am used to seeing it down from the starting. Now you can see the option of lighthouse here. Lighthouse basically generates a report for you. And tells you what can be improved in your HTML page. For example, if I want to see here on mobile. How mobile users are seeing my website. So I will click on mobile. Or I will click on desktop. I will close this tab. I will click on mobile. And I will click on analyze page load here. So this will generate a report for me. Lighthouse. You can see here that a report has been generated. In this performance, accessibility, best practices, SE and PWA. Now you can see here that some things are shown in red. That is, the scope of improvement is in the page. Now you can see here that it is telling you to size your images properly. Your website can be loaded 2.7 seconds fast. So all these suggestions are given to you. By lighthouse. And if you incorporate these suggestions. Then your website will be loaded very well. And will give a good experience to the user. Now you can see here that image elements do not have explicit width and height. So you should give width and height. So you should use the width and height attribute of the image. Which we read in the last video. You should use it. So that your browser has space. When we set width and height in HTML. Then there is space in the browser. Otherwise, if we do not set height and width. Then what will happen. Our browser will not know how much space to reserve. And as long as CSS will load. The whole page will shift from bottom to top.
